results.title: Iranian-Backed Group in Iraq Hits Southern Israel
results.abstract: A drone launched by the Islamic Resistance of Iraq struck the port city of Eilat. In the north, the top Israeli general told troops to prepare for a possible incursion into Lebanon.

multimedia.copyright: Avishag Shaar-Yashuv for The New York Times

results.title: Israeli Bulldozers Flatten Mile After Mile in the West Bank
results.abstract: Videos from Tulkarm and Jenin show bulldozers destroying infrastructure and businesses, as well as soldiers impeding local emergency responders.
results.byline: By Erika Solomon, Lauren Leatherby and Aric Toler

results.title: As Zelensky Calls for Global Focus on Ukraine, Putin Rattles Nuclear Sabers
results.abstract: Hours after the Ukrainian president appealed for the West’s continued support, Russia’s authoritarian leader, Vladimir V. Putin, moved to significantly ease the circumstances under which his country might counter with nuclear weapons.

multimedia.copyright: Dave Sanders for The New York Times
Dave Sanders for The New York Times
Dave Sanders for The New York Times

results.title: France’s Horrifying Rape Trial Has a Feminist Hero
results.abstract: Gisèle Pelicot waived anonymity to make public the trial of her former husband and the 50 men accused of joining him in raping her. Her poise and courage have made her an icon.
results.byline: By Catherine Porter and Ségolène Le Stradic

multimedia.caption: Gisèle Pelicot, center, with her lawyers outside the courthouse in Avignon, France, this month.
Gisèle Pelicot, center, with her lawyers outside the courthouse in Avignon, France, this month.
Gisèle Pelicot, center, with her lawyers outside the courthouse in Avignon, France, this month.

results.title: Iran’s Dilemma: How to Preserve Its Proxies and Avoid Full-Scale War
results.abstract: Iran says Israel wants to trap it into a direct conflict by bombing Hezbollah, even as a new Iranian president tries outreach to the West.

multimedia.caption: President Masoud Pezeshkian of Iran told the United Nations General Assembly on Tuesday that Israel was seeking to trap his country into a wider war.

results.title: Africa’s Youngest Elected Leader Wants a New World Order
results.abstract: In his first interview with Western media since becoming president of Senegal, Bassirou Diomaye Faye said the United Nations has to change to reflect changing world demographics.

results.title: How Canadians Fell Out of Love With Justin Trudeau
results.abstract: Canada’s Liberals are reeling from a string of setbacks, even as the party survived a no-confidence vote in Parliament on Wednesday.

results.title: Online Scammers Posed as Brad Pitt to Get Cash, Spanish Police Say
results.abstract: The authorities in Spain said they had arrested five people who posed as the famous American actor online and swindled two women out of more than $350,000.
results.byline: By Rachel Chaundler and Amelia Nierenberg

multimedia.caption: Brad Pitt in Los Angeles last week. His publicist said the actor had no authorized social media accounts.
Brad Pitt in Los Angeles last week. His publicist said the actor had no authorized social media accounts.

results.title: China Says It Launched a Rocket With a Dummy Warhead Into the Pacific
results.abstract: The ballistic missile launch is a sign of the commitment of Xi Jinping, China’s leader, to continue strengthening the country’s Rocket Force and to project power in Asia.

multimedia.caption: The Chinese military’s DF-41 intercontinental ballistic missiles at a parade at Tiananmen Square in Beijing in 2019.

results.title: Taiwan and U.S. Work to Counter China’s Drone Dominance
results.abstract: Officials hope that Taiwan can become a bigger player in the supply chain for drones, a move that would also help blunt any threats posed to the island by China.
results.byline: By Chris Buckley and Amy Chang Chien

multimedia.caption: A drone developed in Taiwan, on display in 2022. Taiwan plans to expand its military drone arsenal.

results.title: A Litmus Test in Japan: Should Spouses Be Able to Have Different Surnames?
results.abstract: The nine candidates vying to become prime minister have been differentiated by their stances on a law requiring married couples to share a family name.
results.byline: By Motoko Rich and Kiuko Notoya

multimedia.caption: A wedding ceremony at a Shinto shrine in Tokyo.
A wedding ceremony at a Shinto shrine in Tokyo.
A wedding ceremony at a Shinto shrine in Tokyo.

results.title: Ukrainian Poet and Rock Star Fights Near Front and Performs Behind It
results.abstract: Serhiy Zhadan, 50, is a beloved Ukrainian poet as well as a novelist, lyricist and rock star. Furious over the invasion, he enlisted to fight even as his band still plays and his readings fill halls.
results.byline: By Carlotta Gall and Oleksandr Chubko

multimedia.caption: Serhiy Zhadan, a Ukrainian poet, rock star and now a soldier, at a military position in the Kharkiv region of Ukraine, in July. There is a Russian bounty on his head.

results.abstract: With Monday’s attacks across southern Lebanon, the prospect of the escalating conflict enveloping the city has suddenly become real for many Beirut residents.

results.abstract: Anura Kumara Dissanayake offered his broad leftist coalition as the best hope for a different political culture, one not ruled by nepotism and corruption.

results.abstract: The public call deals a blow to Kyiv’s efforts to avoid the partisan acrimony of the U.S. presidential campaign as it tries to rally support for its cause.

results.title: First It Was Lynch Mobs. Now Police Kill Pakistanis Accused of Blasphemy.
results.abstract: The deaths of two men have reverberated across Pakistan, where the charge of insulting Islam has long been a sensitive issue.

results.title: Mexican Senate Votes to Give Military Control of Civilian National Guard
results.abstract: Mexico’s governing party says the guard would be more effective and less corrupt as part of the armed forces. Critics fear the increased militarization of civilian life and a spike in rights abuses.

multimedia.caption: Mexico’s National Guard, a force of some 130,000 members, would be put under the control of the country’s military if a constitutional amendment becomes law.
Mexico’s National Guard, a force of some 130,000 members, would be put under the control of the country’s military if a constitutional amendment becomes law.
Mexico’s National Guard, a force of some 130,000 members, would be put under the control of the country’s military if a constitutional amendment becomes law.

results.title: Hezbollah Targets Tel Aviv as Israel Moves Forces Toward Lebanon
results.abstract: A top Israeli military official hinted to soldiers of a possible ground invasion as the United States and France drafted a cease-fire proposal to try to stave off a broader conflict.

results.abstract: Despite the danger, older residents, firefighters, medics and a few small-business owners chose to stay put in Kiryat Shmona, the northernmost Israeli city near the border with Lebanon.

results.title: Naftali Herstik, Renowned and Influential Cantor, Dies at 77
results.abstract: Part of a long line of cantors, he led services at the Great Synagogue in Jerusalem for 30 years and helped train the next generation.

results.abstract: President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine told the meeting of world leaders that capitulating to Russia would only give its president, Vladimir Putin, the “political space to continue the war.”

results.title: U.S. and Allies Propose Cease-Fire Between Israel and Hezbollah
results.abstract: With fears growing of a wider regional war in the Middle East, the United States, European allies and Arab nations were working to broker a 21-day pause in the fighting.

results.title: Putin Declares Changes to Russian Nuclear Doctrine
results.abstract: President Vladimir V. Putin heightened his warnings against the West, asserting that Russia should be permitted to use nuclear arms in the event of an attack by a nation backed by a nuclear power.

results.abstract: The Swiss police said they had detained “several individuals” after a 64-year-old American woman reportedly died by suicide using the controversial device.

results.title: Exploring the Roots of Mideast Turbulence Onstage
results.abstract: A retrospective in Paris honors Lina Majdalanie and Rabih Mroué, whose theater works have examined the region’s troubles for decades.

results.title: This Black Hole Has a Cosmic Wingspan
results.abstract: Astronomers have discovered a black hole emitting energy in jets longer than the width of 140 Milky Way galaxies.

results.title: Fleeing Israeli Airstrikes in Lebanon, and Worrying About Where to Go Next
results.abstract: After years of decline, Lebanon is ill-equipped to deal with a wave of displaced people. One family left their farm and found themselves homeless in Beirut.

results.title: Tracing Dostoyevsky’s Wayward Path Through Three German Spa Towns
results.abstract: The Russian novelist, a compulsive gambler, lost everything in the opulent spa and gambling towns of Baden-Baden, Bad Homburg and Wiesbaden. An admirer of his books follows his footsteps.

multimedia.caption: The casino in the Kurhaus at Baden-Baden, one of three spa towns where the 19th-century Russian novelist, Fyodor Dostoyevsky, gambled his money away.
